column2: Gluten-free bread, Smoked Salmon, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column3: 1. Toast gluten-free bread until golden brown.
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Use 2 forks to shred the smoked salmon and add it to the top of the avocado
column6: 4. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column7: 5. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Coconut yogurt (sugar-free), Nuts (almonds, walnuts), Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Unsweetened shredded coconut
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer coconut yogurt nuts and mixed berries.
column4: 2. Repeat layers until the container is filled.
column5: 3. Optionally sprinkle with unsweetened shredded coconut.

column2: Gluten-free oats, Chia seeds, Almond milk, Stevia or erythritol (for sweetness), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
column3: 1. Cook gluten-free oats according to package instructions adding chia seeds for extra fiber.
column4: 2. Once cooked sweeten with stevia or erythritol (for sweetness) and top with mixed berries.

column2: Unsweetened almond milk, Avocado, Spinach, Frozen mixed berries, Chia seeds, Stevia or erythritol (for sweetness), Unsweetened shredded coconut
column3: 1. In a blender combine unsweetened almond milk avocado spinach frozen mixed berries and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Sweeten with stevia or erythritol (for sweetness) if desired.
column6: 4. Pour into a bowl and top with unsweetened shredded coconut.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Cheese (optional)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced bell peppers onions and spinach to the skillet.
column6: 4. Crack eggs into the skillet and scramble until cooked through.
column7: 5. Season with salt pepper and a sprinkle of cheese if desired.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Mixed greens, Grilled chicken breast, Avocado, Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Balsamic vinaigrette (gluten-free), Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Grill chicken breast until cooked through and slice into strips.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine mixed greens grilled chicken breast sliced avocado cherry tomatoes and sliced cucumber.
column6: 4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Bell peppers, Quinoa, Black beans, Corn, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Vegan cheese (optional)
column4: 2. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
column5: 3. In a skillet sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add cooked quinoa black beans corn tomato sauce chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
column7: 5. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
column8: 6. Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
column9: 7. Place stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
column10: 8. Optionally top with vegan cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking.

column2: Baby spinach, Chickpeas, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Feta cheese (optional), Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. In a large bowl combine baby spinach chickpeas halved cherry tomatoes thinly sliced red onion and crumbled feta cheese (if using).
column4: 2. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil.
column5: 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Chicken breast, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Gluten-free soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Slice chicken breast into thin strips.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column5: 3. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add sliced chicken breast and stir-fry until cooked through.
column7: 5. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column8: 6. Stir in gluten-free soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column9: 7. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column1: Salmon with Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables
column2: Salmon fillets, Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, cherry tomatoes), Olive oil, Garlic powder, Paprika, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Season salmon fillets with garlic powder paprika salt and pepper.
column5: 3. In a baking dish arrange mixed vegetables and drizzle with olive oil.
column6: 4. Place seasoned salmon fillets on top of the vegetables.
column7: 5. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until salmon is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
column8: 6. Meanwhile cook quinoa according to package instructions.
column9: 7. Serve salmon and vegetables over cooked quinoa.

column1: Grilled Steak with Sweet Potato Mash and Steamed Broccoli
column2: Steak (such as sirloin or ribeye), Sweet potatoes, Broccoli, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Rub steak with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Grill steak to desired doneness about 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
column6: 4. Meanwhile peel and dice sweet potatoes then boil until tender.
column7: 5. Mash cooked sweet potatoes with a fork or potato masher and season with salt and pepper to taste.
column9: 7. Serve grilled steak with sweet potato mash and steamed broccoli.

column1: Shrimp and Vegetable Skewers with Quinoa Pilaf
column2: Shrimp, Bell peppers, Red onion, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic powder, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Quinoa, Vegetable broth, Green peas
column3: 1. Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes.
column4: 2. Thread shrimp bell peppers red onion and cherry tomatoes onto skewers.
column5: 3. In a small bowl whisk together olive oil lemon juice garlic powder Italian seasoning salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Brush skewers with the olive oil mixture.
column7: 5. Grill skewers over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until shrimp are pink and vegetables are tender.
column8: 6. Meanwhile cook quinoa in vegetable broth according to package instructions.
column9: 7. Stir in green peas and let sit for 5 minutes.
column10: 8. Serve shrimp and vegetable skewers with quinoa pilaf.

column1: Chicken and Vegetable Curry with Cauliflower Rice
column2: Chicken breast, Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, carrots, bell peppers, peas), Coconut milk, Curry powder, Garlic, Ginger, Onion, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh cilantro, Cauliflower rice
column3: 1. Slice chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add diced onion minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook until softened and fragrant.
column6: 4. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column7: 5. Add sliced chicken breast to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
column8: 6. Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir to coat with the curry mixture.
column9: 7. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
column10: 8. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
column11: 9. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column12: 10. Serve chicken and vegetable curry over cauliflower rice and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

column2: Beef sirloin, Mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, snap peas, carrots), Gluten-free soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions, Cauliflower rice
column3: 1. Slice beef sirloin into thin strips.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column5: 3. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add sliced beef sirloin and stir-fry until browned on all sides.
column7: 5. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column8: 6. Stir in gluten-free soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column9: 7. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.
column10: 8. Serve beef stir-fry over cauliflower rice.
